Fully Reusable Rockets

RocketX believes a fully and rapidly reusable rocket is the pivotal breakthrough needed to substantially reduce the cost of space access.

Raptor Engines

The RocketX Raptor is a full-flow, staged-combustion, methane-fueled rocket engine manufactured by RocketX. The engine is powered by cryogenic liquid methane and liquid oxygen (LOX), rather than the RP-1 kerosene and LOX used in RocketX's prior Merlin and Kestrel rocket engines.

Starship

The RocketX Starship is planned to be a long-duration cargo- and passenger-carrying spacecraft launched as the second stage of a reusable launch vehicle.
